thread.title: State Senate OKs ride-sharing bill for Upstate NY
thread.title_full: State Senate OKs ride-sharing bill for Upstate NY

author: Staff Report
title: State Senate OKs ride-sharing bill for Upstate NY
text: The State Capitol building in Albany. (file photo) Ron Antonelli/Bloomberg The New York State Senate easily passed a ride-sharing bill that would allow such transportation service to expand to Upstate. The vote in favor of bill S4159 was 53-5. The State Capitol building in Albany. (file photo) Ron Antonelli/Bloomberg Gov. Andrew Cuomo has led the call for ride sharing to be allowed beyond New York City, though the taxi industry has called for tighter measures on operators involving background checks. The senate version, supporters say, requires criminal and driving history background checks, passenger notifications of driver information and trip charges, and the adoption of non-discrimination and zero-tolerance drug and alcohol policies — but not fingerprinting. Tourism officials in Buffalo have lobbied hard for the inclusion of services such as Uber and Lyft, hopefully in time for the NCAA men’s basketball tournament in March. Related Content
